DOC.brief_title: Local Infiltration Analgesia Following Total Knee Arthroplasty
DOC.detailed_description: Postoperative pain often severe follow knee arthroplasty . Recently , local infiltration analgesia ( LIA ) technique develop Drs Kerr Kohan Sydney , Australia . With LIA-technique , long-acting local anesthetic ( ropivacaine ) , nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug ( ketorolac ) , epinephrine infiltrate intraoperatively via intraarticular catheter postoperatively . We ahve complete study unicompartmental knee arthroplasty present study investigate total knee arthroplasty . The primary aim study evaluate intra- postoperative administration ropivacaine , ketorolac epinephrine operate field would affect morphine consumption . Secondary end-points hospital stay , pain intensity side effect . In attempt ass safety technique , knee function patient satisfaction score assess 3 month surgery .
